022
023package org.opt4j.core.genotype;
024
025import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
026import java.util.Collection;
027import java.util.HashMap;
028import java.util.Iterator;
029import java.util.Map;
030import java.util.Map.Entry;
031import java.util.Set;
032
033import org.opt4j.core.Genotype;
034
035/**
036 * The {@link CompositeGenotype} is a base class for {@link Genotype} classes
037 * that consist of multiple {@link Genotype}s. The method
038 * {@link CompositeGenotype#size()} returns the sum of the sizes of the
039 * contained {@link Genotype}s.
040 * <p>
041 * A specific {@link CompositeGenotype} has to add each contained
042 * {@link Genotype} by calling the method {@link #put(Object, Genotype)} where
043 * {@link Object} is an arbitrary identifier.
044 * <p>
045 * Example:
046 * 
047 * <pre>
048 *      SpecificGenotype extends CompositeGenotype&lt;Integer, Genotype&gt; {
049 *              public void setDoubleVector(DoubleGenotype genotype) {
050 *                      put(0, genotype);
051 *              }
052 * 
053 *              public DoubleGenotype getDoubleVector() { 
054 *                      return get(0);
055 *              }
056 * 
057 *              public void setBinaryVector(BooleanGenotype genotype) {
058 *                      put(1, genotype);
059 *              }
060 * 
061 *              public BooleanGenotype getBinaryVector() {
062 *                      return get(1); 
063 *              }
064 *      }
065 * </pre>
066 * 
067 * @param <K>
068 *            the type of key for the mapping
069 * @param <V>
070 *            the type of {@link Genotype}
071 * 
072 * @author lukasiewycz
073 */
074public class CompositeGenotype<K, V extends Genotype> implements Genotype, Iterable<Entry<K, V>> {
075
076        protected final Map<K, V> map = new HashMap<>();
077
078        /**
079         * Constructs a {@link CompositeGenotype}.
080         */
081        public CompositeGenotype() {
082                super();
083        }
084
085        /**
086         * Constructs a {@link CompositeGenotype} with values from a given map.
087         * 
088         * @param map
089         *            initial values
090         */
091        public CompositeGenotype(Map<K, V> map) {
092                this();
093                this.map.putAll(map);
094        }
095
096        /*
097         * (non-Javadoc)
098         * 
099         * @see org.opt4j.core.Genotype#size()
100         */
101        @Override
102        public int size() {
103                int sum = 0;
104                for (Genotype element : map.values()) {
105                        sum += element.size();
106                }
107                return sum;
108        }
109
110        /**
111         * Returns the {@link Genotype} for the given key with an implicit cast to
112         * the specific {@link Genotype} type.
113         * 
114         * @param <G>
115         *            the type of genotype
116         * @param key
117         *            the key
118         * @return the addressed genotype
119         */
120        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
121        public <G> G get(Object key) {
122                V value = map.get(key);
123                return (G) value;
124        }
125
126        /**
127         * Adds a {@code key}, {@code value} pair.
128         * 
129         * @param key
130         *            the key
131         * @param value
132         *            the value ({@code Genotype})
133         */
134        public void put(K key, V value) {
135                map.put(key, value);
136        }
137
138        /**
139         * Removes all {@code key}, {@code value} pairs.
140         */
141        public void clear() {
142                map.clear();
143        }
144
145        /**
146         * Returns all {@code keys}.
147         * 
148         * @return all {@code keys}
149         */
150        public Set<K> keySet() {
151                return map.keySet();
152        }
153
154        /**
155         * Returns all {@code values} which are the contained {@link Genotype}
156         * objects.
157         * 
158         * @return all {@code values}
159         */
160        public Collection<V> values() {
161                return map.values();
162        }
163
164        /**
165         * Returns the {@link Iterator} over the {@link Entry} pairs.
166         * 
167         * @return the iterator over the entry pairs
168         */
169        @Override
170        public Iterator<Entry<K, V>> iterator() {
171                return map.entrySet().iterator();
172        }
173
174        /*
175         * (non-Javadoc)
176         * 
177         * @see org.opt4j.core.Genotype#newInstance()
178         */
179        @Override
180        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
181        public <G extends Genotype> G newInstance() {
182                try {
183                        return (G) this.getClass().getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
184                } catch (InstantiationException e) {
185                        throw new RuntimeException(e);
186                } catch (IllegalAccessException e) {
187                        throw new RuntimeException(e);
188                } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
189                        throw new RuntimeException(e);
190                } catch (InvocationTargetException e) {
191                        throw new RuntimeException(e);
192                } catch (NoSuchMethodException e) {
193                        throw new RuntimeException(e);
194                } catch (SecurityException e) {
195                        throw new RuntimeException(e);
196                }
197        }
198
199        /*
200         * (non-Javadoc)
201         * 
202         * @see java.lang.Object#toString()
203         */
204        @Override
205        public String toString() {
206                StringBuilder s = new StringBuilder("[");
207                for (Entry<K, V> entry : this) {
208                        K key = entry.getKey();
209                        V value = entry.getValue();
210                        s.append(key).append("=").append(value).append(";");
211                }
212                return s.append("]").toString();
213        }
214}
